sentences.en: ...since their crushing defeat in the local elections.
sentences.cn: …自从他们在地方选举中遭到毁灭性的挫败以来。

sentences.en: a crushing defeat in the election
All these bear upon him with crushing weight.
sentences.cn: 这些问题使他的负担极其沉重.

sentences.en: Chueh - min thought he was making a crushing retort.
sentences.cn: 觉民 提出了这个他自己以为是很有力的反驳.

sentences.en: For extrudates there are side crushing strength tests, bulk crushing strength tests, abrasion tests.
sentences.cn: 对挤条产品有侧压强度的测试, 堆积强度测试和耐磨测试.

sentences.en: It was impossible to advance in regular steps without crushing some of them at each tread.
sentences.cn: 用平常的走法,一步总要踩死它们几条.

sentences.en: Large gas holders were ruptured and collapsed by the crushing action of the blast wave.
sentences.cn: 大型瓦斯罐由于受到爆震波的压挤破裂倒塌了.

sentences.en: One long column, half - burned, had fallen across the lawn, crushing the cape jessamine bushes.
sentences.cn: 有根圆柱还烧剩一半, 横倒在草皮上, 把茉莉花丛压碎了.

sentences.en: Roller mills grind essentially by crushing and attrition.
sentences.cn: 辊磨机主要靠挤压和摩擦研碎物料.

sentences.en: The conquerors believed in crushing the defeated people into submission , knowing that they could not win their loyalty by the victory.
sentences.cn: 征服者们知道他们的胜利并不能赢得失败者的忠心,于是就认为只有通过武力才能将他们压服.

sentences.en: The enemy suffered a crushing defeat.
The last excitement lay in the crushing of trick amendments.
sentences.cn: 最后动人心弦的一举是在击败一些诡计多端的修正案上.

sentences.en: They could not have understood why it was, in the end, a crushing misfortune for Poe.
sentences.cn: 他们无法理解为什么它到头来却成了坡的致命的不幸.

sentences.en: They lived underneath a crushing tyranny.
sentences.cn: 他们生活在难以忍受的暴政下.

sentences.en: This method can be used for pellets with flat faces with crushing along the axis.
sentences.cn: 这种方法可以用于具有平面的片剂,沿着轴向施加压力.

sentences.en: To Wilson and House this was a crushing blow, almost a betrayal.
sentences.cn: 对威尔逊和豪斯来说,这是致命的打击, 几乎是一种背叛.

words.tran_cn: 粉碎；迷恋；压榨；拥挤的人群
打击；[食品] 压碎机；压碎的东西；镇服人的事实
压倒的；决定性的；不能站起来；支离破碎的
压破，征服，冲入（crush的过去式和过去分词形式）

phrases.tran_cn: 常温抗碎强度；冷碎强度
破碎车间；破碎装置；压车场
压碎强度；抗碎强度；破碎强度

trans.tran_cn: 压倒的，决定性的，支离破碎的
trans.tran_en: A crushing defeat, burden, or disappointment is a very great or severe one

trans.tran_cn: 压碎，压坏( crush的现在分词)，镇压，征服，冲入(crush的现在分词)
